birth_place.en: Wugang Prefecture, Baoqing Fu, Hunan Province

description.zh-cn: 清末民初政治人物、军事家，发动护国战争反对袁世凯称帝，被誉为“护国大将军”。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader of the late Qing dynasty and early Republic of China, known for launching the National Protection War against Yuan Shikai's attempt to restore monarchy. He is hailed as the 'Great General of National Protection'.

description.zh-cn: 中国清末民初的军事家、政治家，曾任中华民国大总统，后试图恢复帝制。
description.en: A Chinese military and government official during the late Qing dynasty and the early Republic of China. He served as the President of the Republic of China before attempting to restore the monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代思想家、政治家、教育家、史学家、文学家。曾是蔡锷的老师和政治盟友。
description.en: A Chinese scholar, journalist, philosopher, and reformist who lived during the late Qing dynasty and the early Republic of China. He was Cai E's teacher and political ally.

description.zh-cn: 滇系军阀首领，与蔡锷等人共同发动重九起义和护国战争。
description.en: A warlord of Yunnan who, along with Cai E, launched the Double Ninth Uprising and the National Protection War.

description.zh-cn: 中国军事家，护国战争中担任护国军第二军总司令，与蔡锷、唐继尧并称“护国三杰”。
description.en: A Chinese military leader who served as the commander of the Second Army in the National Protection War, known as one of the 'Three Heroes of National Protection' along with Cai E and Tang Jiyao.

description.zh-cn: 由蔡锷、唐继尧、李烈钧等人发动的反对袁世凯复辟帝制的内战。
description.en: A civil war waged by Cai E, Tang Jiyao, Li Liejun and others against Yuan Shikai's attempt to restore monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯试图恢复君主制，改元“洪宪”的政治运动。
description.en: The political movement of Yuan Shikai's attempt to restore the monarchy with the era name 'Hongxian'.

description.zh-cn: 清末维新派在湖南长沙创办的新式学堂。
description.en: A new-style school founded by reformers in Changsha, Hunan, during the late Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 日本培养陆军军官的教育机构，曾有大量中国留学生在此学习军事。
description.en: An educational institution in Japan for training army officers, where many Chinese students studied military science.

description.zh-cn: 1911年10月30日（农历九月初九），蔡锷等人在昆明发动起义，响应武昌起义。
description.en: An uprising launched by Cai E and others in Kunming on October 30, 1911 (the ninth day of the ninth lunar month), in response to the Wuchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 清末官员，时任云贵总督，在重九起义中被蔡锷逮捕。
description.en: A late Qing official serving as the Viceroy of Yungui, who was arrested by Cai E during the Double Ninth Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国元帅，曾称蔡锷影响其整个前半生。
description.en: A Marshal of the People's Republic of China who stated that Cai E influenced the entire first half of his life.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代军事理论家，蔡锷的同庚与莫逆之交。
description.en: A modern Chinese military theorist and a close friend of Cai E.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷的妻子。
description.en: Wife of Cai E.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷的侧室，协助其在北京密谋反对袁世凯。
description.en: Concubine of Cai E, who assisted him in plotting against Yuan Shikai in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 民国初年北京八大胡同名妓。蔡锷曾假装迷恋她以麻痹袁世凯的监视。
description.en: A famous courtesan in Beijing's Bada hutong during the early Republic. Cai E pretended to be infatuated with her to mislead Yuan Shikai's surveillance.

description.zh-cn: 由蔡锷于1911年辑录曾国藩、胡林翼治兵言论而成的军事著作。
description.en: A military work compiled by Cai E in 1911, consisting of sayings on military management by Zeng Guofan and Hu Linyi.

description.zh-cn: 清代晚期政治家、战略家，其治兵言论被蔡锷辑录成书。
description.en: A statesman and strategist of the late Qing dynasty whose sayings on military management were compiled into a book by Cai E.

description.zh-cn: 清代晚期官员、军事家，其治兵言论被蔡锷辑录成书。
description.en: An official and military leader of the late Qing dynasty whose sayings on military management were compiled into a book by Cai E.

description.zh-cn: 为反对袁世凯称帝，由蔡锷、唐继尧等人在云南组织的军队。
description.en: An army organized in Yunnan by Cai E, Tang Jiyao, and others to oppose Yuan Shikai's proclamation as emperor.

description.zh-cn: 清代湖南省宝庆府下辖的一个州，是蔡锷的出生地。
description.en: A prefecture under Baoqing Fu, Hunan Province, during the Qing dynasty, and the birthplace of Cai E.

description.zh-cn: 日本九州的城市，蔡锷在此病逝。
description.en: A city in Kyushu, Japan, where Cai E passed away due to illness.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷与潘蕙英的长子。
description.en: The eldest son of Cai E and Pan Huiying.

description.zh-cn: 滇军将领，在蔡锷任四川督军但因病无法视事时，代行其职务。
description.en: A general of the Yunnan Army who acted on behalf of Cai E when Cai was appointed Military Governor of Sichuan but was too ill to perform his duties.

description.zh-cn: 中国同盟会成员，与蔡锷、唐继尧一同在昆明发动重九起义。
description.en: A member of the Tongmenghui who launched the Double Ninth Uprising in Kunming along with Cai E and Tang Jiyao.

description.zh-cn: 1898年，蔡锷入长沙时务学堂，师从梁启超。
description.en: In 1898, Cai E entered the Shiwu Xuetang in Changsha and studied under Liang Qichao.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷与梁启超是师生，后成为反对袁世凯称帝的紧密政治盟友。
description.en: Cai E and Liang Qichao were teacher and student, and later became close political allies in opposing Yuan Shikai's enthronement.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷发动护国战争，武力反对袁世凯复辟帝制。
description.en: Cai E launched the National Protection War to militarily oppose Yuan Shikai's restoration of the monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷担任护国军第一军总司令，在四川等地与北洋军作战，是护国战争的主要领导者和发起者之一。
description.en: As the Commander-in-Chief of the First Army of the National Protection Army, Cai E fought against the Beiyang Army in Sichuan and was one of the main leaders and initiators of the National Protection War.

description.zh-cn: 护国战争的爆发迫使袁世凯取消帝制。
description.en: The outbreak of the National Protection War forced Yuan Shikai to abandon his monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 护国战争的爆发迫使袁世凯取消洪宪帝制。
description.en: The outbreak of the National Protection War forced Yuan Shikai to abolish the Hongxian Monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷与唐继尧共同在云南发动重九起义和护国战争，是亲密的战友。
description.en: Cai E and Tang Jiyao jointly launched the Double Ninth Uprising and the National Protection War in Yunnan, and were close comrades-in-arms.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷与李烈钧同为护国军总司令，并称“护国三杰”。
description.en: Cai E and Li Liejun were both commanders-in-chief of the National Protection Army and were known as the 'Three Heroes of National Protection'.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷与蒋百里同庚，是莫逆之交。
description.en: Cai E and Jiang Baili were of the same age and were very close friends.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷与李根源、唐继尧等人在昆明发动起义，响应武昌起义。
description.en: Cai E, along with Li Genyuan and Tang Jiyao, launched an uprising in Kunming in response to the Wuchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 重九起义中，时任云贵总督李经羲被逮捕。
description.en: During the Double Ninth Uprising, the incumbent Viceroy of Yungui, Li Jingxi, was arrested.

description.zh-cn: 1915年11月，在梁启超的帮助下，蔡锷得以从北京潜逃，为发动护国战争做准备。
description.en: In November 1915, with the help of Liang Qichao, Cai E successfully escaped from Beijing to prepare for the launch of the National Protection War.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷与唐继尧等人在云南宣布独立后，共同组织了讨伐袁世凯的护国军。
description.en: After declaring Yunnan's independence, Cai E, Tang Jiyao, and others co-founded the National Protection Army to crusade against Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 朱德晚年在回忆录中写到“蔡锷先生影响我整个前半生”。
description.en: In his later years, Zhu De wrote in his memoirs, 'Mr. Cai E influenced the entire first half of my life.'

description.zh-cn: 于1911年辑录曾国藩、胡林翼的治兵言论编成《曾胡治兵语录》。
description.en: In 1911, he compiled the sayings of Zeng Guofan and Hu Linyi on military management into the 'Zeng-Hu's Maxims on Military Affairs'.

description.zh-cn: 《曾胡治兵语录》辑录了曾国藩的治兵言论。
description.en: 'Zeng-Hu's Maxims on Military Affairs' compiles the sayings of Zeng Guofan on military management.

description.zh-cn: 《曾胡治兵语录》辑录了胡林翼的治兵言论。
description.en: 'Zeng-Hu's Maxims on Military Affairs' compiles the sayings of Hu Linyi on military management.

description.zh-cn: 潘蕙英为蔡锷的侧室。
description.en: Pan Huiying was Cai E's concubine.

description.zh-cn: 为麻痹袁世凯的监视，蔡锷在北京期间假装与小凤仙过从甚密。
description.en: To mislead Yuan Shikai's surveillance, Cai E pretended to have a close relationship with Xiao Fengxian while in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷出任四川督军后因喉病复发，一切事务由罗佩金代行。
description.en: After Cai E became the Military Governor of Sichuan, his throat condition relapsed, and all his duties were carried out by Luo Peijin on his behalf.

description.zh-cn: 李根源与蔡锷、唐继尧等人在昆明发动起义，响应武昌起义。
description.en: Li Genyuan, along with Cai E and Tang Jiyao, launched an uprising in Kunming in response to the Wuchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 唐继尧与蔡锷、李根源等人在昆明发动起义，响应武昌起义。
description.en: Tang Jiyao, along with Cai E and Li Genyuan, launched an uprising in Kunming in response to the Wuchang Uprising.
